chinese.english: “Obesity robs people of hope and ambition,'' Griffith said. “It leads to depression, to diminished self-esteem.''

chinese.chinese: 心磁共振成像（MRI）显示，接受CSC治疗患者梗死区内不能存活的心肌组织质量及能存活组织的比例显著提高，有统计学意义。同时接受CSC治疗患者的“明尼苏达心力衰竭评分量表”分数明显提高，而对照组则几乎无波动。
chinese.english: Cardiac MRI showed that the CSC-treated patients had statistically significant improvements in mass of nonviable myocardial tissue and the percentages of viable tissue within the infarcted region. Minnesota Heart Failure Scores improved significantly in the CSC-treated patients while remaining almost flat in the control group.

chinese.chinese: 作者总结道：“在美国可以清除浸润性宫颈癌。为了达到这一目标，我们需要采取全面的国家卫生保健计划，并强调其实用性和卫生保健的公平，以给予所有人富有同情心的保健护理。未来不再有浸润性宫颈癌是可能的，尽管我们还需要必须不断创新并对我们的方法时刻保持警惕来减轻这一负担，同时减少获得筛查的差异，并攻克疫苗接种的障碍。”
chinese.english: "Invasive cervical cancer can be eliminated in the United States," concluded the authors. "To achieve this goal, we need to adopt a comprehensive national health care program that underscores accessible and equitable health care, one that delivers compassionate care to all. A future without invasive cervical cancer is possible, although we must be innovative and vigilant in our approach to reduce its burden, as well as reduce the disparities in access to screening and overcome the obstacles to vaccination."

chinese.chinese: 但是很难区分破碎的心综合征和心脏病, Phan说。因此,如果你有症状,如胸痛和呼吸困难, 不要假定你是心碎综合症——打911。
chinese.english: But it's difficult todistinguish between broken heart syndrome and a heart attack, Phan said. Thus, if youexperience symptoms such as chest pain and difficulty breathing, don'tassume you're having broken heart syndrome -- call 911.

chinese.chinese: 情人节那天, 那些情场失意的人会说遭受了“心碎”。原来一颗破碎的心是一个现实的身体状况，心碎综合征发生在高度紧张的或情感的时代, 如一个痛苦的分手, 一个配偶的死亡、失去一份工作或极度愤怒, Loyola大学健康医疗体系心脏病学家Binh An P. Phan.博士说。
chinese.english: Broken heart syndrome also is calledstress cardiomyopathy. Symptoms are similar to those of a heart attack, including chest pain and difficultybreathing. The good news is that, over time,the symptoms go away. And unlike heart attack patients, people with broken heart syndrome do not suffer lastingdamage to their hearts, Phan said.

chinese.chinese: 已被起诉的医生，最终可能会实行防御性医疗，安排不必要的检查和药物治疗或拒绝治疗患复杂疾病的患者以防将来被起诉。有相同处境的医生会感到力不从心，从而导致更多的差错和医疗官司。
chinese.english: Doctors who have been sued may end up practicing defensive medicine, ordering unnecessary tests and medications or refusing to treat patients with more complex illnesses altogether as a safeguard against future litigation. Those same doctors can also become burned out, which can lead to even more errors, and more malpractice claims.

chinese.chinese: 然而许多专家认为,由于过多的盐摄入导致心脏病的风险可能被高估了。“除了对有潜在的心、肾功能障碍的患者,几乎没有结论性的证据表明,适量盐的摄入会增加心脏病的危险,”华盛顿医院心脏中心的副主任Stuart Seides博士说。
chinese.english: However many experts believe that the risk of heart disease due to too much salt may be overrated. “Other than in those patients with underlying heart or kidney failure, there is little conclusive evidence that moderate salt intake actually increases heart disease risk,” said Dr. Stuart Seides, associate director of cardiology at the Washington Hospital Center.

chinese.chinese: “但是，低荷尔蒙压力水平/母爱呵护组都有着强烈的自尊心，其对照组显示出相反的结果。”
chinese.english: "However, while the low hormonal stress levels in the high maternal care group were associated with high self-esteem, subjects in the low maternal care group exhibited low self-esteem."

chinese.chinese: 代替恐惧的是，她患有罕见病皮肤粘膜类脂蛋白沉积证，被称为“无法抵抗的好奇心”
chinese.english: Instead of fear, SM, whose rare condition is known as Urbach-Wiethe disease, describes "an overwhelming feeling of curiosity."

chinese.chinese: 但是当外科医生在术前谈话中清晰传达了他们的意见后，病人可能仅仅听懂了一部分。“很有可能的是，病人遗忘了之前与外科医生交谈的部分。”塞维兹医生说。病人可能在期待高风险手术的同时受到惊吓，一心想着如何活着通过手术。“手术让病人的心收紧，我不知道这是怎么发生的，或许比生存还要可怕。”
chinese.english: But while the surgeons believed they conveyed this information clearly during preoperative conversations, the patients probably heard only part of the story. “It's entirely possible that patients are missing this part of their early interaction with surgeons,” Dr. Schwarze noted. Patients may be overwhelmed at the prospect of a high-risk operation and focused solely on getting through the operation alive. “The operation is already a lot for patients to take in. I don't know how much it occurs to them that there may be something worse than survival.”

chinese.chinese: 此次研究是关于钙和维生素D添加剂对体重变化影响的最大规模的双盲、安慰剂对照临床试验，是由国立卫生研究院心、肺和血液研究所资助的。
chinese.english: The latest study is believed to be the largest double-blind, placebo- controlled clinical trial to report the effects of calcium and vitamin D supplementation on weight change. It was funded by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) of the National Institutes of Health.

chinese.chinese: 就目前而言，这种治疗并没有得到广泛的应用。进一步的研究计划在未来一年的追踪研究的参与者，并评估其长期的效果和效益。这项研究是由美国国立卫生研究院（国家心、肺和血液研究所）支助的。
chinese.english: For now, the treatment is not widely available. Further research is planned to track the study participants over the next year and evaluate its longer-term effects and benefits. This study was funded by the NIH's National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute.

chinese.chinese: 他说病人更关心完好地回家，而不是带着一颗跳动的心去医院。
chinese.english: He says patients are more concerned about getting home intact than getting to the hospital with a beating heart.

chinese.chinese: 有来自于美国和芬兰的研究证据表明，通过排除吸烟、饮酒这两个众所周知的致癌因素后，发现扁桃体癌发病率仍呈上升趋势。这引发了斯德哥尔摩的卡罗林斯卡研究所的伊娃·蒙科·威兰博士及其同事的好奇心，他们决定寻找可以解释扁桃体癌日益增多的其他流行病学病因。
chinese.english: Reports from both the US and Finland have documented a rise in the incidence of tonsillar cancer. This occurred in the absence of any increase in smoking or alcohol consumption, two well-known causative factors for the malignancy. This led Dr. Eva Munck-Wikland, from the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm, and colleagues to look for other epidemiologic trends that might explain the growing incidence of tonsillar cancer.

chinese.chinese: 建议草案从现在开始进行90天公众评议，之后，FDA非常希望正式批准一些克隆动物食品用以食用，同时声明对克隆绵羊的研究尚不充分，但FDA对克隆动物及其后代产品的健康问题并不十分担心。
chinese.english: The proposal is now open to a 90-day public comment period, after which the FDA is widely expected to officially approve food from some cloned animals for human consumption (for sheep, they say, there is still not enough data); the draft states that the FDA has few concerns about the health of cloned animals or the food that they produce.

chinese.chinese: 报告说“赞比亚和莱索托有诸多值得赞赏的宗教健康资产，如：地区分布合理、理解支持政府工作、感化民众不只基于口头而更体现在实际护理工作中、工作责任心强”，报告估计目前非洲30％－70％的健康基础设施都隶属于宗教信仰组织，然而这些信仰组织与主流公共卫生组织的合作却非常少。
chinese.english: The report, “Appreciating assets: mapping, understanding, translating and engaging religious health assets in Zambia and Lesotho”,  estimates that between 30 per cent and 70 per cent of the health infrastructure in Africa is currently owned by faith-based organisations yet there is often little cooperation between these organisations and mainstream public health programmes.

chinese.chinese: 他们补充，太极，通过平缓的移动来完成一系列的姿势，能改善平衡和心、肺功能，最近又发现在健康人身上，太极有利于免疫系统功能。
chinese.english: Tai Chi, in which a person performs a series of poses in a flowing motion, improves balance and heart and lung function, and recently was shown to benefit immune system function in healthy individuals, they add.

chinese.chinese: Molleston是TONIC八中心III期试验印第安纳州大学医学院网点的首席研究员，这项试验由国立糖尿病、消化疾病与肾病研究院资助，目的是研究治疗8-17岁脂肪肝患者的治疗方案，同时，这是同类型研究中至今为止最大的一项研究。
chinese.english: Molleston is the pediatric principal investigator for the IU School of Medicine site of TONIC, an eight-center Phase III study funded by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Disease, which is investigating treatment options for Fatty Liver Disease in 8 to 17 year olds and is the largest study of its type to date.
